intro: Psephellus pulcherrimus, commonly known as the showy sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with fleshy, succulent leaves and clusters of pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in xeriscapes and native plant gardens.
